title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

title: Home
text:
Welcome to the Gapminder Data Analysis
The Gapminder dataset provides data on global development trends, including variables such as life expectancy, GDP per capita, population, and more.
Explore the following analyses:

Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
Life Expectancy and Population
Country Analysis

title: Country Analysis
text:
Country Analysis: Life Expectancy, GDP per Capita, and Population
This page explores the changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population over time for a specific country. In this example, weâ€™ll analyze China using the gapminder dataset.
Below is a graph showing the trends of life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population over time for China.

# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Read the Gapminder dataset (replace the URL with the location of your dataset if needed)
data = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Filter data for a specific country (China in this case)
country_data = data[data['country'] == 'China']

# Create a figure for multiple y-axes
fig, ax1 = plt.subplots(figsize=(10,6))

# Plot Life Expectancy
ax1.set_xlabel('Year')
ax1.set_ylabel('Life Expectancy', color='tab:blue')
ax1.plot(country_data['year'], country_data['life_expectancy'], label='Life Expectancy', color='tab:blue')
ax1.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor='tab:blue')

# Plot GDP per Capita on the second y-axis
ax2 = ax1.twinx()
ax2.set_ylabel('GDP per Capita', color='tab:green')
ax2.plot(country_data['year'], country_data['gdp_per_capita'], label='GDP per Capita', color='tab:green')
ax2.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor='tab:green')

# Plot Population on the third y-axis
ax3 = ax1.twinx()
ax3.spines.right.set_position(("outward", 60))  # Move the third y-axis outward
ax3.set_ylabel('Population', color='tab:red')
ax3.plot(country_data['year'], country_data['population_millions'], label='Population', color='tab:red')
ax3.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor='tab:red')

# Add title and adjust layout
plt.title('Life Expectancy, GDP per Capita, and Population Over Time (China)')
fig.tight_layout()  # Adjust layout to prevent overlap
plt.show()

title: Life and GDP
text:
Analyzing Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita using the Gapminder dataset.
Below is a scatter plot visualizing this relationship.

# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Read the Gapminder dataset (replace the URL with the location of your dataset if needed)
data = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Create a scatter plot of GDP per capita vs Life Expectancy
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.scatter(data['gdp_per_capita'], data['life_expectancy'], alpha=0.5)
plt.xscale('log')  # Log scale for GDP per Capita
plt.title('Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita')
plt.xlabel('GDP per Capita (log scale)')
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy (years)')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
Analyzing Life Expectancy and Population
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and population using the Gapminder dataset.
Below is a scatter plot visualizing this relationship.

# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Read the Gapminder dataset (replace the URL with the location of your dataset if needed)
data = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Create a scatter plot of Population vs Life Expectancy
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.scatter(data['population_millions'], data['life_expectancy'], alpha=0.5)
plt.xscale('log')  # Log scale for GDP per Capita
plt.title('Life Expectancy vs Population')
plt.xlabel('Population in millions(log scale)')
plt
